sen.j: 普照（ふしょう、生没年不詳）は、奈良時代の僧。
sen.e: Fusho (dates of birth and death unknown) was a Buddhist priest who lived during the Nara period.
Fusho (dates of birth and death unknown) was a Buddhist priest who lived during the Nara period.
Fusho (year of birth and death unknown) was a Buddhist priest who lived during the Nara period.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに従ってyear of birth and death unknownとしました。

sen.j: 母は白猪与呂志（しらいのよろし）の娘。
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of Yoroshi SHIRAINO.
His mother was a daughter of SHIRAI no Yoroshi.
His mother was a daughter of SHIRAI no Yoroshi.

sen.j: 当初興福寺に住し、天平5年（733年）出家者に正しい戒を授けるための伝戒師を招請するため栄叡（ようえい）とともに唐に渡った。
sen.e: Originally a priest of Kofuku-ji Temple, Fusho went to Tang Dynasty of China together with Yoei in order to invite preceptors who officially transmit the Buddhist priests to those who became priests in 733.

Originally a priest of Kofuku-ji Temple, Fusho went to Tang Dynasty of China together with Yoei in order to invite denkaishi (teacher who transmits the precepts) to transmit official kai (precepts) to Buddhist priests in 733.

sen.j: 洛陽大福先寺で具足戒を授けられ、道璿（どうせん）に来日を促した。
sen.e: He followed gusokukai (Vanaya Precepts) at Dafuxian Temple in Luoyang, China, and asked Dao Xuan to go to Japan.
He was taught gusoku-kai (Vanaya Precepts) at Daifukusen-ji Temple in Luoyang, China, and asked Dosen to come to Japan.
sen.cmt: wording*as there is the pronunciation of the name, 道璿 in the brackets of the original japanese sentence, I followed it *reference for 大福先寺: http://japanese.cri.cn/189/2006/05/24/1@64052.htm(as I found different pronunciation for 大福先寺 in chinese in the following URL [http://www.acmuller.net/descriptive_catalogue/indexes/index-monasteries.html], I am not sure if the one by the translator is correct, so I changed it to japanese pronunciation [the reference is above])
sen.e: He was taught gusoku-kai (Vanaya Precepts) at Daifukusen-ji Temple in Luoyang, China, and asked Dosen to come to Japan.

sen.j: 唐に滞在すること10年目にして揚州大明寺の鑑真に拝謁して日本への渡航を要請し、天平勝宝6年（754年）鑑真に従って日本へ戻った。
sen.e: Having stayed in China for 10 years, Fusho was finally granted an audience to Jiàn Zhēn of Daming Temple, Yangzhou, requested his visit to Japan, and returned to Japan together with Jian Zhen in 754.
Having stayed in China for 10 years, Fusho was finally granted an audience to Ganjin of Daimyo-ji Temple, Yangzhou, requested his visit to Japan, and returned to Japan together with Ganjin in 754.
sen.cmt: *as the same reasons mentioned above, I changed the pronunciation for 鑑真 and 大明寺*reference for 大明寺: http://damingsi-japan.com/city/spectacle.html
sen.e: Having stayed in China for 10 years, Fusho was finally granted an audience to Ganjin of Daimyo-ji Temple, Yangzhou, requested his visit to Japan, and returned to Japan together with Ganjin in 754.

sen.j: この間に栄叡は病没するが、栄叡の最期を看取ったのは普照である。
sen.e: Yoei died of an illness during their trial to return to Japan, and it was Fusho who was beside him when he breathed his last.
Yoei died of an illness during their attempt to return to Japan, and it was Fusho who was beside him when he breathed his last.
Yoei died of an illness during their attempt to return to Japan, and it was Fusho who was beside him when he breathed his last.

sen.j: 苦楽を共にした栄叡とは親友で、栄叡が没した時は号泣したと伝わる。
sen.e: Fusho and Yoei, who shared all the joys and agonies, were good friends, and it is said that Fusho cried loud when Yoei passed away.
Fusho and Yoei, who shared all joys and agonies, were good friends, and it is said that Fusho cried openly when Yoei passed away.
Fusho and Yoei, who shared all joys and agonies, were good friends, and it is said that Fusho cried openly when Yoei passed away.

sen.j: その後は東大寺に住し、天平宝字3年（759年）には旅をする人の飢えを癒すため京外の街道に果樹を植えることを奏上している。
sen.e: Back in Japan, Fusho stayed at Todai-ji Temple, and in 759 he proposed planting of fruit trees along streets outside Kyoto to help ease the hunger of travelers.
Back in Japan, Fusho stayed at Todai-ji Temple, and in 759 he proposed the planting of fruit trees along streets outside Kyoto to help ease the hunger of travelers.

sen.j: その後、奈良西大寺 (奈良市)の大鎮を勤めた。
sen.e: Later he served daichin of Saidai-ji Temple in Nara (today's Nara city).
Later he served as Daichin (chief administrative priest of a temple) of Saidai-ji Temple in Nara (today's Nara city).

sen.j: 井上靖の小説『天平の甍』では主人公で、入唐してから鑑真（作中では鑒真）を伴い日本へ帰国するまでの生涯が描かれた。
sen.e: In the novel by Yasushi INOUE, "Tenpyo no Iraka" (Roofing Tiles of Tenpyo), Fusho plays the main character of the story, and his life from arrival in Tang to return to Japan with Jian Zhen (or 鑒真 in the novel) is depicted in the novel.
sen.cmt: （作中では鑒真）→そのままにしました。

sen.j: また、1980年に公開された映画版では中村嘉葎雄が普照を演じた。
sen.e: Japanese actor Katsuo NAKAMURA played Fusho in the film version of the novel released in 1980.
